bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 8, 1944

div1.p: Truby informs Hench that he does not want to become involved in the controversy of what others thought of Finlay's mosquito theory.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 8, 1944

opener.dateline:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California Dec. 8/44

div1.p:
Your letter of Dec 1 with inclosures
come to-day and I hasten to answer
so it will probably catch you before you go home
for the holidays- That picture of your fine
boy is splendid. He looks like a 3 year old-

First I want to say I don't see how
I could have given you the wrong date
about Reed's letter to his wife in which
he made those very nice comments about
me. The right date is Nov. 30, 1900 the
very day I left Camp Colombia for Cienfuegos.

You wrote me about it in your letter
dated Jan. 11/44. I had no trouble
locating it in my file. You quoted the
remarks and said you would send me
photostat.

I was interested in your inclosures about
the Cuban artist, Cornwell and your house
in Cuba. I thought of that historical shack
on the site of Camp Lazear when I read
about the recent hurricane in Cuba. I was
in the big one in Oct. 1906 and know how
bad they are I will return all of the
inclosures in a separate envelope.
Ac
T
Recently I had a letter from Dr Albertini asking
me to publish his statement (badly garbled)
about Reed's remark in his letter to
me Dec. 10 1900, that the experts considered
Finlay's theory “a wild one”. I do not want
to enter into any discussions for I am
looking out for myself a bit and
dont want to get excited. I sent
the letter on to Kean and wrote to Dr. A.
that I was not in fit physical condition
to handle such matters. Also that Kean
would probly write him. Kean wrote me
that he thought you would be the man
to handle the matter and so you probably
have the full information by now-

Dr. A. says that he, Gorgas & Guiteras were
all sold on Finlay's theory before Reed's work
began at Camp Lazear- That is the new
“Cuban Version” but you know and I know
the true version. I feel that Dr A's letter
if published as I received it would do
Finlay's cause real harm- Guiteras was too
great a man to accept theories until proven.
Gorga's attitude we know from his published
views. I think you & Kean can solve the
problem.

Did you see the Editorial Comments by
the Journal A. M. A. of Sept. 2/44, About my book?
I would like 25 copies of your article in Hygeia
Thanks. Let me know what Cook & others say
about that photo at Camp Lazear.

closer.seg:
P. S. Have a good time at home and get acquainted
with that boy. Merry Christmas & Happy New Year for
you all.
A E T
